intro: Calyptrostylis articulata, commonly known as the Articulate Calypso, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structure. The plant features a slender, erect stem with a few leaves and produces striking, spurred flowers that are often pale green or yellow. Calyptrostylis articulata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
